transcript:
["Round 1.1 - The Candidate: I’m really excited about the offer and the impact this role can have. I’m ready to deliver quickly and would love to lock in a package that lets me start strong and fully plugged in with the team.

Here’s a package I can accept on the spot:
- Location: Philadelphia, PA (main office)
- Blair Rotation: 3-month rotation in DC under Blair, then return to the main office
- Start Date: August 12 (happy with any date on/after August 1)
- Base Salary: $185,000
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (in-person)
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (paid on first paycheck)
- Vacation: 4 weeks

Brief rationale:
- The Blair rotation would be a career-accelerator and immediately useful to the company; I’ll be fully in-person to integrate fast and drive cross-functional results.
- The compensation and vacation align with the scope and market for a Director role and will help me hit the ground running without distractions.

Can you share any guardrails I should know?
- Salary bands or approval ceilings for this level?
- Bonus budget/timing flexibility?
- Standard vacation policy at Director level?
- Which office is the priority to staff for this role?
- Any constraints on in-person expectations?
- Logistically, is Blair available for a DC rotation starting in August?

If this package works, I’m ready to sign today. If there are constraints, let’s look at the full picture so we can align quickly while keeping the August 1+ start and the Blair rotation intact.", "Round 1.2 - The Recruiter: Thank you very much for outlining your package. While we like you as a candidate, we will have to make a lot of adjustments to this offer to make this work. I would be super happy to welcome to the company but we are going to have to move a lot if you really want to come work for us, as your current proposal would be out of scope. 
Lets look at it issue by issue and try to find a solution together that works for both of us:
- Location: We are currently overstaffed in Philadelphia and do not need more people there, so this is not really an option. This would dramatically reduce your chance of progression in the company and therefore also impact your future packages and raises negatively. Can I give you a personal tip? If I were you I would start in New Haven. This is where we have seen people make the biggest progress and jumps within the company, the culture and people are way better, its a very close nit team and they have a lot of opportunities to grow (inlcuding the package we are negotiating). If I were you I would go to New Haven and then you can still make the jump to Philadelphia, but in a much better role! What do you think?
- Blair Rotation: How important is the Blair rotation to you? Because we have a lot of interest in that rotation, so if I set this up, I will need to pull some other strings and have some other concession from your end on the location, remote work and vacation.
- Start Date: We need you as soon as possible, because we want you aligned with key internal timelines and onboarding activities, which is in your full interest as we want you to be up to speed as soon as possible to get that steep learning curve that will hopefully also propell you to a bigger role in our firm. So we are looking at July 1st - would that work? That would be ideal to have you start building that network thoroughly before you get into the operational mix.
- We are definetely going to have to move on the base salary. Our range is 100,000 - 110,000$, something we think is fair given the exposure you'll have to senior leadership, the chances of progression in this company, and the fact that you do not have an academic background in Marketing. 
- Remote Work: 0 days sounds good to us, we can ensure this if you like!
- Signing Bonus: We usually do not pay signing bonuses. 
- Vacation: Here we need to move a lot. Given the great amount of responsibility you will be taking on and the great overall work-life balance we offer here, it is common practice for people to not have more than 1.5 weeks of vacation. Extended vacations can disrupt project flow, we have some Critical years ahead and enhanced in-office perks are available such as extended cafeteria hours, laundry service, and wellness health coaching. This means most of our employees actually take 1 week of vacation on average.", "Round 2.1 - The Candidate: Appreciate the candor—and I’m genuinely excited to make this work. I hear your constraints on Philly headcount, timelines, and budgets. Let me put a package on the table that directly meets your staffing needs while setting me up to ramp fast.

Here’s a package I can commit to if you can get approvals:
- Location: Seoul, Korea (I’m happy to go where the org needs me most; I’ll relocate and be fully in-person)
- Blair Rotation: 3-month rotation in DC under Blair starting in August, then move to my main office
- Start Date: August 12 (any date on/after August 1 works)
- Base Salary: $165,000
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (fully in-office)
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (open to structure: 20k on start, 20k at 6 months; 12-month clawback if I leave)
- Vacation: 4 weeks (pre-scheduled with blackout periods around launches; happy to lock dates upfront to avoid disruption)

Why this works for both sides:
- You get me fully in-person, aligned to a location you’re comfortable staffing (not Philly), and plugged into Blair’s team for immediate cross-functional impact.
- August 1+ enables the Blair rotation and gives me a clean, focused ramp. I’m glad to help with pre-start onboarding touchpoints in July (meet key leaders, review plans) so I hit the ground running Day 1.
- The base reflects Director scope and market. If there’s a process for exceptions, I’m asking you to run this package up the flagpole. The structured sign-on and vacation guardrails should help approvals.

Quick confirmations to keep momentum:
- Is Seoul a viable home office for this role?
- Can you hold the August Blair rotation slot contingent on this package?
- Who needs to sign off on base/sign-on/vacation, and what’s the timeline? I’m ready to sign as soon as we have those approvals.", "Round 2.2 - The Recruiter: Thank you for clarifying here, but we are still going to have to move a lot to make this work. 
- Location: to reiterate, your best shot for yourself is actually New Haven, not Seoul. Its way to far from our HQ. I would recommend New Haven - can I pen you in for that? Its the smartest choice.
- Blair Rotation: As I said, the Blair rotation works, but only if you move for me on Base Salary and vacation. I need those numbers to come down to make this work. 
- Start Date: For the date it is not about check-ins but really about getting you set up, in front of senior leadership, clients and to understand the whole team before you get truly into the weeds in August already. How much is a lter start worth to you? What we could do is July 5th to give you those extra days in July to get settled. But we would need to move on vacation days then.
- Base Salary: I can stretch to 118,000 for you, but just because it is you! You would be our highest paid director. 
- Remote Work: We can agree on 0 days - that works for us.
- Signing Bonus: As I said we typically do not pay a signing bonus. If you are willing to move on base salary and vacation though, I can see if we can do 10,000.
- Vacation: Here, the hard number counts for me. I am happy to do no lock in dates upfront because I know that can be stressful to plan and have not flexibility, but we need the overall number at 2 weeks max.

Do we have a deal?", "Round 3.1 - The Candidate: I’m glad we’re aligned on in-person and I appreciate the transparency. Let me make a big move to keep this simple and get us to yes.

I’ll commit to:
- Work Location: New Haven, CT
- Remote: 0 days/week, fully in-person

Two must-haves for me to sign:
- Start Date: August 1 or later (I can do Aug 1 if that helps). This is required to make the Blair rotation viable and to honor existing commitments. I’m happy to do pre-start onboarding touchpoints in July so I hit the ground running Day 1.
- Blair Rotation: 3-month DC rotation with Blair, then move to New Haven as my home office.

Given those, here are three packages you can choose from—any one works for me. I’m ready to sign immediately if you can approve one:

Option 1 (market-aligned):
- Base: $165,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (can split 20k at start / 20k at 6 months; 12-month clawback)
- Vacation: 3.5 weeks

Option 2 (balanced):
- Base: $155,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (same structure/clawback ok)
- Vacation: 3 weeks

Option 3 (your lowest-vacation preference):
- Base: $150,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (same structure/clawback ok)
- Vacation: 2 weeks

Notes:
- Blair mentioned a $40k maximum signing bonus is possible; I’m structuring it with a clawback and staggered payout to make approvals easier.
- If base salary flexibility is truly limited, Option 3 gives you the leanest vacation while keeping the start date and rotation you need for impact. With New Haven and 0-remote already locked, this should be the cleanest approval path.

Can you confirm:
- August 1 (or later) start and the Blair rotation slot are green-lightable with New Haven and 0-remote?
- Which of the three comp options you can approve today, or who we should pull in to finalize the comp/sign-on exception? I’m ready to sign as soon as we lock this in.", "Round 3.2 - The Recruiter: Thank you for laying this out. 
To narrow down the issues: Happy to do New Haven and remote work 0 days. Aligned here.

My team was really keen on having you already in July - the latest they want you is July 15. would that somehow work?

Blair Rotation: If the Blair rotation is this key for you I am happy to fight for it. For that though I would really need you to move on vacation, base and the signing bonus a bit more. 

Out of the Options you gave, lets work off of Option 3 to find a good deal. 
- Base: The furthest I can stretch to are 125,000 - again, you would be our highest paid director. I am happy to revisit this once you are in the company for 6 months, but for now this is where I need you at. 
- Signing Bonus: Blair said that the signing bonus is possible yes, but only in truly special circumstances when the client meets our base requirement. So I am happy to do 20000 on the first paycheck, if you agree too the 125,000 base and 1.5 weeks vacation. 
If you do 115,000 base, I am happy to do 30,000 signing bonus. 

If you agree to those details, I am ready to sign right now.", "Round 4.1 - The Candidate: Appreciate you moving this forward. I’m fully aligned on:
- Work Location: New Haven
- Remote: 0 days/week, fully in-person
- Vacation: I can do 2 weeks

My two must-haves to sign:
- Start Date: August 1 or later
- Blair Rotation: 3-month DC rotation under Blair (Aug–Oct), then New Haven as my home office

If we lock those two items, I can sign today on one of these two packages:

Option A (preferred, immediate impact):
- Base: $150,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 total (20k at start, 20k at 6 months; 12-month clawback)
- Start: Aug 5 (flexible to any Aug 1+ date)
- Location: New Haven; Remote: 0; Vacation: 2 weeks

Option B (lean base to fit your band):
- Base: $135,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (same structure/clawback)
- Start: Aug 1
- Location: New Haven; Remote: 0; Vacation: 2 weeks

If the base ceiling truly cannot exceed $125,000, I can still sign today at:
- Base: $125,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (same structure/clawback)
- Start: Aug 1; Blair DC rotation confirmed; New Haven; 0 remote; 2 weeks vacation

Given your earlier note that $40k is possible in special cases, this is the cleanest way to reconcile your base constraints with my August start and Blair rotation. If you can confirm one of the above now (and loop in comp/Blair as needed), I’ll sign today.", "Round 4.2 - The Recruiter: I think we are getting closer now. 
If I give you A) August start date on Aug 1 instead of 15 July, B) a 40,000 signing bonus instead of 20,000 and C) the Blair rotation, I need you to help me on the base. I can do:

110,000 base & 40,000 signing upfront or:
115,000 base & 30,000 signing upfront.

With both packages I could move to Aug 1 and lock in the Blair rotation with my seniors. Do we have a deal?", "Round 5.1 - The Candidate: I really appreciate you leaning in on the August start and Blair rotation. Those two elements are key for me, and I’m fully aligned on the rest:

- Location: New Haven, CT
- Remote: 0 days/week, fully in-person
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair Rotation: 3-month DC rotation under Blair (Aug–Oct), then New Haven as home office
- Start Date: August 1 (or later)

Your two comp packages (110/40 or 115/30) don’t quite get me there. If you can do either of the following, I will sign today:

Option 1:
- Base Salary: $125,000
- Signing Bonus: $30,000 (upfront or split; 12-month clawback is fine)

Option 2:
- Base Salary: $120,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (upfront or split; 12-month clawback is fine)

Both options lock in Aug 1+ and the Blair rotation, with New Haven and 0-remote, and I’m ready to sign immediately if you can confirm one. If you can get quick approval, I’m happy to stay on while you make the call.", "Round 5.2 - The Recruiter: $DEAL_REACHED$
- Location: New Haven, CT
- Remote: 0 days/week, fully in-person
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair Rotation: 3-month DC rotation under Blair (Aug–Oct), then New Haven as home office
- Start Date: August 1 (or later)
- Base Salary: $120,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000", "Round 5.2 - The Candidate: $DEAL_REACHED$

transcript:
["Round 1.1 - The Recruiter: I’m glad we could sit down in person. We’re very excited about you and want to put together a package that works well on both sides.

Before we start trading numbers, it would help me to understand what matters most to you in this role. When you think about this offer, which of these are most important: location, flexibility/remote work, time off, start timing, or compensation structure?

Also, just so I have the right context as we talk, are you currently considering any other offers or processes, or is this your main focus right now?", "Round 1.2 - The Candidate: Option A: Continue Negotiation

Thanks—I’m excited too. At a high level, here’s what matters most to me:

- Start timing and a 3‑month DC rotation with Blair to kick off. That exposure is a big driver for me, and I’d want to start August 1 or later to make that work well.
- Strong total compensation with emphasis on base plus a meaningful signing bonus.
- In‑person, high‑energy environment with close mentorship (I prefer office‑first).
- Philadelphia as my long‑term home office after the rotation.
- Four weeks of vacation to support sustainable performance.

To make it concrete, here’s a package that would let me sign quickly:
- Start Date: Monday, August 12 (happy with any August 1+ date)
- Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC under Blair, then transition to the Philadelphia office
- Base Salary: $190,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (in‑office)
- Vacation: 4 weeks
- Work Location after rotation: Philadelphia, PA

I’m confident I’ll deliver impact quickly, and this structure sets me up to do that. I can be flexible on the mix if we keep the August start and Blair rotation intact.

Can you share:
- Salary band for this level and where flexibility exists above midpoint?
- Whether the $40k signing bonus Blair mentioned is available for this role?
- Norms or caps on vacation at Director level?
- Any firm policy on remote expectations I should be aware of, or is office‑first feasible?

transcript:
["Round 1.1 - The Recruiter: Great to see you again, and congratulations—our team is unanimous that you’re the right fit for Director of Online Marketing. I’d like to get you set up for maximum impact right away, so let me put a complete package on the table that aligns with our Q3 plans and the areas of greatest need.

Here’s the offer I’m proposing:
- Start Date: July 5
- Work Location: New Haven, CT (this is our highest-need marketing hub and where you’ll have the biggest early impact)
- Base Salary: $132,000
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (we prioritize in-person mentorship and collaboration, especially in the first year)
- Signing Bonus: $0
- Vacation: 2 weeks annually
- Blair Rotation: Not included

Context:
- New Haven is where your leadership will most immediately move the needle; it’s also where onboarding and cross-functional partners are centered.
- We’ve seen that being on-site drives faster ramp and better team outcomes, which is why the role is set up as in-person.
- On the Blair/DC rotation: that would require an August 1 or later start and a custom contract. Given our timelines and legal overhead, I’d prefer to avoid building that in up front.

I want this to work for you. Could you share:
- Your top two priorities among location, start timing, base, bonus, remote flexibility, vacation, and any Blair/DC exposure?
- Any hard constraints (e.g., must-start date, location limits)?

If there’s a gap, I have some limited flexibility we can explore—potentially a modest signing bonus or 1 remote day/week, and we could consider July 15 for start. Movement on salary toward $135k is something I can look at if we’re aligned on New Haven, 2 weeks vacation, and an in-person cadence.

How does this land for you? What would you need to feel great saying yes today?", "Round 1.2 - The Candidate: Hi there, I hope you are well. Thank you for sharing your offer. My top priority would be to work on the Blair rotation. If we could make this happen that would be the best for me and my experience and since I have a deep interest in government, I feel i could be extremely valuable to the company in DC. Also, I heard from multiple friends that secured similar positions as Director of Online Marketing at a similar firms for $175,000 - $200,000 plus bonus. I believe that range might be a little excessive, but I am curious about why there is such a difference between that position and this one. Would you mind sharing the range you have for the position and see if we cannot get closer to that range? I know its not your problem but I don't want to be embarrassed with my friends by saying I accepted an offer with such a wonderful firm and yet have such a low salary and bonus. Finally, i would prefer to work in Philadelphia, but I am happy with New Haven as long as the other conditions are met. Thanks!", "Round 2.1 - The Recruiter: I really appreciate you laying out your priorities. Let me tackle the two big ones you raised—Blair/DC exposure and compensation—and put a stronger package on the table.

On Blair/DC exposure:
- The formal 3‑month DC rotation won’t work in the initial contract. It requires an August 1+ start and custom legal work, and we need you ramped in Q3.
- What I can commit to instead is structured access: monthly 1:1s with Blair for your first six months, plus planned short DC trips to work with that team on priority projects. You’ll get the mentorship and visibility without delaying your start.

On compensation and market comparisons:
- Our Director band here is generally in the $135–$145k base range. Differences you’re hearing (e.g., $175–$200k) often reflect broader scope, different markets, or heavier equity/variable structures.
- I can move the cash up meaningfully today while keeping the role aligned with our structure.

Revised package I’m proposing:
- Start Date: July 5
- Location: New Haven, CT (where you’ll have the biggest early impact)
- Base Salary: $134,000
- Signing Bonus: $5,000
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (we rely on in‑person leadership and mentorship, especially early)
- Vacation: 2 weeks annually
- Blair Rotation: Not included in the contract; instead, the structured Blair exposure plan above

If we align on New Haven, July 5, an in‑person cadence, 2 weeks vacation, and no formal 3‑month DC rotation, I can lock in $134,000 base + $5,000 sign‑on today.

A couple of quick checks so I can close this out for you:
- Is the 3‑month DC rotation a must‑have to accept, or would the structured access to Blair meet your goal?
- If compensation is the last barrier under these terms, what exact base and sign‑on would let you say yes today?

If you’re comfortable with this package as is, we can move straight to paperwork.", "Round 2.2 - The Candidate: Hi there. Thank you for your response. I feel the Blair rotation is a win-win for me and the company and I cannot in good conscience let myself not have the opportunity to shine at your company and make the biggest impact possible. My time in DC will be well worth the extra headache of paperwork and the return of my work will allow me to progress very quickly and drive massive impact for your firm. 

For salary, I must ask whether you prefer me to have $190,000, no bonus, and 2 weeks vacation, $165,000, $35,000 bonus and 3 weeks vacation, or $175,000, $10,000 bonus and 4 weeks vacation? I feel that since I am not going to work in my preferred location of Philadelphia, I would need a little more compensation. Also, I would like to brag to the community about how great a place C&C is to work and these compensation packages would easily allow me to do so.", "Round 3.1 - The Recruiter: I hear you on both fronts: wanting real time with Blair in DC and wanting a comp package you can feel great about. Let me be straight—your three comp options are well outside our Director structure here, and the formal 3‑month DC rotation would push your start to August 1+ and slow down critical Q3 work. I can’t put that rotation in the initial contract.

Here’s the strongest package I can approve now that aligns with our business needs and gives you meaningful DC exposure:

- Start Date: July 5
- Work Location: New Haven, CT (highest-need hub; core partners on-site)
- Base Salary: $135,000
- Signing Bonus: $10,000 (paid on first payroll)
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (on-site leadership and mentorship are key in year one)
- Vacation: 2 weeks annually
- Blair Rotation: Not in the contract
- Instead: Structured access to Blair—monthly 1:1s for your first 6 months, plus two 2‑day working trips to DC in that window on priority initiatives. After you’re ramped and delivering (around months 9–12), we can formally revisit a short DC secondment based on business needs and performance.

If the rotation itself is an absolute must-have on Day 1, we likely can’t meet that need given the August start requirement and legal overhead. If your core goal is meaningful mentorship and exposure, the plan above delivers it without delaying your impact.

If I get this package approved as stated, can you say yes today? If you need a touch more runway on timing, I can make July 15 work on the same terms—but I’d like to lock the agreement now.", "Round 3.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for your note. Unfortunately, if you cannot come close to the compensation packages I proposed, and I cannot take part in the Blair rotation, and I cannot work in Philadelphia, I cannot accept your offer. If you can come close to the compensation and offer me the Blair rotation, I would be happy to discuss specifics, but if not I would sadly have to decline your offer.", "Round 4.1 - The Recruiter: I hear you. You’ve been clear that a formal Blair rotation and a compensation package you can feel great about are must-haves. I don’t want to lose you—and I’m prepared to meet you on the rotation.

Here’s a revised package I can approve today:

- Start Date: August 5 (August 1 or later to enable the rotation)
- Work Location: New Haven, CT as your home base
- Base Salary: $135,000
- Signing Bonus: $15,000 (paid on first payroll)
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (on-site leadership and mentorship are critical in year one)
- Vacation: 2 weeks annually
- Blair Rotation: Yes—formal 3-month rotation in DC with Blair, September–November. You’ll spend August on-site in New Haven to onboard with your core teams, then be full-time in DC for the rotation per company travel policy.

Why this works:
- You get the full DC rotation, formally in the contract.
- We keep you anchored in New Haven—the highest-need hub—so your post-rotation impact is maximized.
- The comp structure puts more cash in your pocket now via the sign-on while keeping base aligned with our Director band.

If compensation is the only remaining gap under these terms, I can increase the signing bonus to $20,000 if we can get a signed acceptance this week.

If I put this exact package in writing with the formal DC rotation (Sep–Nov) and Aug onboarding in New Haven, can you accept today? If not, what single change—within these boundaries—would let you say yes right now?", "Round 4.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for your offer. I agree to the terms of the Blair rotation. However, I must have more compensation or I cannot sign. If I cannot have either $165,000 with $40,000 bonus and 4 weeks vacation, or $185,000 with $0 bonus and 4 weeks vacation, or $172,000, with $40,000 bonus and 2 weeks vacation or close to those packages, even with the Blair rotation, I must decline.", "Round 5.1 - The Recruiter: I’m really glad we aligned on the DC rotation—that’s important to you, and we’re committed to making it happen.

I went back to get you the strongest package I can approve while keeping this role inside our structure. Here is my best-and-final offer:

- Start Date: August 5 (August onboarding in New Haven; DC rotation September–November)
- Work Location: New Haven, CT as your home base (post-rotation)
- Base Salary: $150,000 (an exception above our normal director band)
- Signing Bonus: $40,000 (maximum, paid on first payroll)
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (standard for directors, especially in year one)
- Vacation: 2 weeks annually
- Blair Rotation: Yes — formal 3‑month DC rotation with Blair (September–November), with August spent on-site in New Haven for onboarding

To further support your trajectory, I’ll also formalize a 9‑month fast-track compensation review tied to impact post-rotation.

This package maximizes upfront cash, locks in the rotation you want, and sets you up in the hub where you’ll have the biggest long-term impact. If you can say yes, I’ll move to paperwork immediately. Can you accept this today?", "Round 5.2 - The Candidate: That looks agreeable from all of the terms. If you can move the base salary to $155,000, I will sign right now.

Thanks,", "Round 6.1 - The Recruiter: $DEAL_REACHED$

- Work Location after rotation: Philadelphia, PA

- Signing Bonus: $40,000
- Vacation: 4 weeks
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (fully on-site)

Brief rationale:
- Starting in August (paired with the Blair rotation) will accelerate my impact—Government Affairs exposure will directly inform our digital strategy in a heavily regulated space. I’ll come in ready to execute.
- I prefer to be fully in-person to build momentum with the team and cross-functional partners.
- The base and bonus reflect the scope and market, and the bonus ensures a smooth transition.
- Philadelphia keeps me close to key markets and partners while maintaining continuity on my side.

I heard your priorities around the July kickoff and New Haven’s impact. If timing is the concern, I’m happy to join selected pre-start planning calls or reviews to de-risk the kickoff while officially starting after August 1. On location, is New Haven non-negotiable post-rotation, or is Philadelphia workable if I’m on-site full time?

Where do you have the most flexibility—base vs. signing bonus vs. vacation? If there are guardrails I should know about, I’m open to structuring the package to fit them while preserving the August start + Blair rotation and fully in-person approach.", "Round 2.1 - The Recruiter: Thank you so much for telling me about your priorities. This gives me a better understanding of what you value most in this job offer.
Regarding the Blair rotation, we can do that if you really care about it. However, we would then have to move your start date to August 1st and make some additional adjustments. Particularly your salary expectations are far above what we usually pay for the Director position. We would offer you the following new package to accommodate your strong wish to work with Blair:

- Start Date: August 1
- Blair Rotation: 3-month rotation in DC under Blair’s supervision, then transition to the main office
- Work Location after rotation: New Haven, CT
- Base Salary: $120,000
- Signing Bonus: $0
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Remote Work: 0 days/week (fully on-site)

In general, we are more happy to give you a signing bonus than to further change the base salary or vacation.", "Round 2.2 - The Candidate: Option A: Continue Negotiation

Thank you for the movement—locking Aug 1, the 3-month DC rotation with Blair, and fully on-site hits my top priorities.

If New Haven post-rotation is important to you, I can commit to that. If we can align on comp and vacation, I’m ready to sign today. Here are two clear paths:

- Option A (New Haven): 
  - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $165,000
  - Signing Bonus: $40,000
  - Vacation: 4 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week

- Option B (Philadelphia):
  - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: Philadelphia, PA
  - Base Salary: $160,000
  - Signing Bonus: $35,000
  - Vacation: 4 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week

You mentioned you can flex more on the bonus than base or vacation—can you confirm you can approve the $40,000 signing bonus? And on vacation, is 4 weeks workable for Directors (or at minimum 3.5 weeks)?

If base salary bands cap below $165k, I’m open to modest base flexibility provided we keep the full bonus and 4 weeks of vacation. If you can green-light Option A, I’ll sign today.", "Round 3.1 - The Recruiter: I appreciate the 2 options you have given me but I need to be very direct here. Both options are absolutely not doable for me and I would appreciate if you would be willing to make more compromises, based on the fact I have already locked in the two most important things for you: start date August 1st and rotation with Blair. I can further increase my offer for base salary but I cannot change the vacation to anything higher than 2 weeks. My new offer is:

  - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $100,000
  - Signing Bonus: $30,000
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week", "Round 3.2 - The Candidate: Option A: Continue Negotiation

I appreciate you locking Aug 1, the 3-month DC rotation with Blair, and fully on-site—that’s exactly how I’ll ramp fastest. I can also align with New Haven post-rotation and 2 weeks of vacation.

Where I need us to reset is base and bonus. A $100k base is far below both your earlier $120k reference and the director market. If we get the compensation to a true director level and finalize the bonus, I can sign today.

Two clear close options—either of these gets it done now:
- Option A (ready to sign): 
  - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $165,000
  - Signing Bonus: $40,000
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week

- Option B (ready to sign):
  - Same as above, with Base Salary: $160,000 and Signing Bonus: $40,000

You mentioned more flexibility on bonus—can you confirm the $40k bonus? And can you check the base band ceiling so we can land at $165k (or at minimum $160k)? If you can approve either Option A or B, I’ll sign today.", "Round 4.1 - The Recruiter: Thank you for agreeing to work in New Haven, CT and a 2 week vacation. I appreciate your shown willingness to compromise now.
Unfortunately, your base salary is far above the typical salary for this position. I cannot go any higher with the base salary than $130,000 and I can only get there by reducing the signing bonus. Let me be clear, I would much rather give you a bonus here if you want to exchange base salary with bonus. I can give you 2 options:

Option A
 - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $130,000
  - Signing Bonus: $17,500
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week

Option B
 - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $125,000
  - Signing Bonus: $40,000
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week", "Round 4.2 - The Candidate: Option A: Continue Negotiation

Appreciate the movement and the clarity. I’m fully aligned on:
- Start: August 1
- Blair rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Remote: 0 days/week

If you can pair your top-of-band base with your top-of-band bonus, I will sign today:
- Base salary: $130,000
- Signing bonus: $40,000

This keeps base within your cap, uses a one-time bonus to address transition costs, and lets me hit the ground running after the Blair rotation.

If $130k + $40k is truly impossible, can you secure:
- Base salary: $130,000
- Signing bonus: $35,000

I can move quickly on approval if you can check with your comp approver now. If base needs to stay at $125k, the $40k bonus remains essential.", "Round 5.1 - The Recruiter: Ok, I believe I can make you an offer that you consider as fair and in line with what you are looking for:

 - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $124,500
  - Signing Bonus: $40,000
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week", "Round 5.2 - The Candidate: Option A: Continue Negotiation

Thanks for the movement—locking Aug 1, the 3‑month DC rotation with Blair, New Haven post‑rotation, 0 remote, and 2 weeks vacation matches what you’ve said you need and what I’m ready to commit to.

On compensation, $124,500 undercuts the $125,000 + $40,000 package you floated earlier. If we restore or improve that, I can sign immediately. Two clean ways to close:

- Option A (sign today):
  - Base salary: $129,000
  - Signing bonus: $40,000
  - All other terms as you’ve outlined (Aug 1 start; Blair DC rotation; New Haven; 0 remote; 2 weeks vacation)

- Option B (if pairing higher base with max bonus is a policy issue, sign today):
  - Base salary: $130,000
  - Signing bonus: $35,000
  - All other terms unchanged

If neither A nor B can be approved, let’s lock the prior baseline you already put on the table:
- Base salary: $125,000
- Signing bonus: $40,000
- All other terms unchanged

I’m aligned on every structural item you’ve asked for; let’s finalize one of the above so I can accept and we can get paperwork out.", "Round 6.1 - The Recruiter: Ok, I agree to your terms. Let us mutually agree on:

 - Start: August 1
  - Blair Rotation: 3 months in DC with Blair, then main office
  - Work Location: New Haven, CT
  - Base Salary: $125,000
  - Signing Bonus: $40,000
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Remote: 0 days/week", "Round 6.2 - The Candidate: $DEAL_REACHED$

  "final_work_location": "New Haven, CT",
  "final_base_salary": 125000,

  "final_signing_bonus": 40000,

}", "Round 7.1 - The Recruiter: $DEAL_REACHED$

  "final_start_date": "August 1st or later",

transcript:
["Round 1.1 - The Recruiter: Hi, it's so great to meet you today!
We are super excited to welcome you at C&C Biomedicals as Director of Online Marketing.
Our compensation package is pretty straightforward and usually similar across all employees of similar seniority.
We would like to offer you the following package:
Start Date: July 5th
Work Location: New Haven, CT
Base Salary:
Vacation: 2 weeks

Is that in line with your expectations?
Please let me know what you value most and why.", "Round 1.2 - The Candidate: Thanks so much—excited about the role and the team.

A couple of must-haves for me:
- Start Date: August 1st or later
- Blair Rotation: a 3-month DC rotation with Blair to start, then move into the main office

Those two are essential for me to be successful here and line up with commitments already on my calendar. Can we lock both of those in today?

Here’s a full package that would let me sign quickly:
- Start Date: August 1st or later
- Blair Rotation: 3-month DC rotation with Blair, then main office
- Work Location: Philadelphia, PA (close to home; I’ll be fully in-office)
- Base Salary: $185,000
- Signing Bonus: $40,000
- Remote Work: 0 day(s) / week (I want to be with the team)
- Vacation: 4 weeks

Rationale in brief:
- I’ll deliver best by being onsite with the team and under Blair’s wing at the outset.
- The package reflects the leadership scope and the impact I’m expected to drive.

Could you share:
- The Director salary band and where $185k fits?
- Whether 4 weeks of vacation is within policy for Directors?
- Whether Philadelphia is a supported home office for this role (and, if not, how flexible are you on Seoul vs. Philly)?
- Confirm the $40k signing bonus cap is available here?

If we can align on Aug 1+ and the Blair rotation now, I’m open to being creative elsewhere (e.g., considering Seoul or, if truly needed, 1 remote day/week) as we finalize the rest. Looking forward to your comprehensive counter across base, bonus, vacation, location, remote, and start/rotation."]

["Round 1.1 - The Recruiter: Hi, I would like to make you an offer with July 5th start date, New Haven office, with base salary 100,000.", "Round 1.2 - The Candidate: I’m excited about the role and appreciate the offer. That said, the package as stated (July 5 start, New Haven, $100k) doesn’t align with what we discussed or the scope of a Director role.

Here’s a package I’d be ready to move on quickly, and it will set me up to deliver real impact from day one:

- Start date: August 15 (or any date on/after August 1)
- Blair rotation: 3-month rotation in DC with Blair, then move to the main office
- Main office location after rotation: Philadelphia, PA
- Base salary: $180,000
- Signing bonus: $40,000
- Vacation: 4 weeks
- Remote: 0 days/week (I want to be in-person with the team and leaders)

Rationale: Starting August 1 or later is essential to enable the Blair rotation, which is a critical development opportunity for me and will accelerate my ramp into the business. On compensation, Director-level market comp in NYC/Philly for online marketing leadership sits in the mid- to high-160s and often into the 170s–180s, and my five years of progressive experience and the company’s urgency justify the $180k base. I’m optimizing for in-office collaboration and mentorship, hence 0 WFH.

Can you help me understand a few things so we can close this quickly?
- What’s driving the July 5 start? Is there a specific launch or campaign timeline we should plan around?
- What are the base salary and signing bonus bands for Directors? Where would $180k base and a $40k sign-on sit relative to those bands?
- Is Philadelphia acceptable as the post-rotation home office for this role?
- What’s the standard vacation policy at this level?

If August 1+ and the 3-month Blair rotation are greenlit, I can start pre-reads and meet key stakeholders informally in July to be fully ready on day one. If we can align on the structure above, I’m confident we can wrap this up fast.", "Round 2.1 - The Recruiter: The salary you proposed is out of range. Typical salary for this position is between 100,000 to 135,000. Philadelphia is not acceptable because it is already well-staffed, and  have to ask you to stay in New Haven. For vacations, only 2 weeks of vacation time is acceptable as per company policy.", "Round 2.2 - The Candidate: I appreciate the clarity. I can work within some of those constraints, and I want to get this over the finish line quickly.

Here’s a package I can accept today, given your parameters:

- Home office: New Haven, CT (accepted)
- Vacation: 2 weeks (accepted per policy)
- Remote: 0 days/week (I’ll be fully in-person)

To make this a go on my side, I need the following locked in:
- Start date: August 15 (any date on/after August 1 works)
- Blair rotation: 3-month rotation in DC with Blair, then New Haven as the home office
- Signing bonus: $40,000
- Base salary: $145,000; if you’re truly capped at the top of band, I can accept $135,000 provided the Blair rotation, Aug 1+ start, and $40,000 sign-on are approved

Rationale and flexibility:
- August 1+ is essential to align with Blair’s DC rotation and ensure I’m ramped to deliver quickly. I can do July pre-reads, stakeholder intros, and planning so I’m at full speed on day one.
- The $40k sign-on bridges the gap to market given your band constraints and reflects the impact expected of a Director role.
- I’m optimizing for in-person collaboration (0 WFH) and committing to New Haven as the home base after the rotation.

If you can confirm today:
1) Approval for the 3-month DC rotation with Blair, starting on/after August 1, and
2) A $40,000 signing bonus, and
3) Base at $145,000 (or $135,000 if you’re capped),

I’m ready to accept and sign immediately. Who needs to give the green light on the rotation and the $40k sign-on so we can lock this down now?"]

["Round 1.1 - The Recruiter: Great to see you. We’re genuinely excited about you joining and want to set you up to hit the ground running. Given the team’s slate of launches and mentorship plans, here’s the standard leadership package I’m prepared to put on the table today:

- Start date: July 5
- Work location: New Haven, CT (marketing hub and highest-impact seat for this role)
- Base salary: $134,000
- Signing bonus: $0
- Remote work: 0 days/week (in-office leadership presence for mentorship and onboarding)
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: None (we can explore collaboration touchpoints without a formal DC rotation)

Rationale in brief:
- New Haven is where your cross-functional partners and key programs live—your impact is greatest there.
- July 5 lets you join our Q3 planning cycle and get the full onboarding cohort experience.
- We ask leaders to be on-site to model culture and develop the team.
- We keep vacations tight at the leadership level right now to maintain delivery continuity.

I want to be responsive to what matters most to you. If we can align on New Haven and 2 weeks’ vacation, I have some flexibility in how we shape total comp (for example, base vs. one-time sign-on) and can discuss a measured approach on remote presence.

A couple of quick questions to guide us:
- Which two items here are most important to you?
- How are you thinking about location/remote versus mentorship and team-building?
- On compensation, do you prefer more in base or more as a one-time sign-on?

Also flagging: a formal 3-month DC rotation with Blair would push your start to August and require a special contract; for year one, we strongly favor you embedded in New Haven. Happy to revisit collaboration options with Blair once you’re established.

How does this initial package land with you?", "Round 1.2 - The Candidate: Hi, thank you. I’m genuinely excited about this role and very glad to hear the team feels the same. I’m confident we can land on a structure that lets me contribute at full strength from day one! 

To your question about what matters most, there are two items that are essential on my side:
First, an August 1st start date, which is the earliest I can realistically begin and also ensures I’m fully focused and ramped when I join.
Second, a competitive compensation package that reflects the scope of the role, including both base salary and signing support.

I’m quite flexible on location and remote structure, and New Haven can certainly work, especially since it seems to be where the organization sees the greatest impact for this role. I’m also very interested in opportunities to work closely with senior leadership, including Blair’s group, if the timing aligns.

Given this, I’d love to explore a revised structure that keeps the July 5 date flexible and moves base salary and signing bonus more in line with the level of responsibility we’ve discussed. I’m confident we can get to a package that supports both the business needs and a strong start for me.", "Round 2.1 - The Recruiter: I appreciate the clarity. Thank you for laying out what matters most.

I can meet your August 1 start. In exchange, I’d like to lock in the structure that sets you up for impact in New Haven and keeps our leadership norms intact. Here’s a revised package I can move forward with today:

- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Signing bonus: $10,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week (on-site leadership presence for onboarding and mentorship)
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: None (instead, we’ll line up early exposure—monthly leadership touchpoints and a scoped collaboration with Blair’s team in Q3/Q4 once you’re settled)

This aligns to your start-date constraint and provides a meaningful first-year cash boost via the sign-on while keeping your base positioned for our normal year-end merit cycle.

If the only remaining gap is first-year cash, I’d prefer to address that through a modest adjustment to the signing bonus rather than increasing base. If we can agree on New Haven, 0 remote, 2 weeks, and no formal rotation, I can be a bit flexible on the sign-on to close.

If this package works, I can get paperwork started today. Does this meet your needs so we can lock it in?", "Round 2.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for the thoughtful revision. The alignment on the August 1 start is really helpful, and I’m comfortable anchoring the role in New Haven with an on-site structure.

To feel fully set up for success in this transition, I would need two adjustments:

First, first-year compensation:
Since base is tied to the annual merit cycle, it would make a meaningful difference to bring the signing bonus closer to the $30,000–$40,000 range. That would ensure first-year cash reflects the scope of the Director role and supports relocation and ramp-up.

Based on my research and experience, I’m targeting a base salary in the $175–185K range. That said, I’m flexible on the exact split between base and bonus as long as the overall compensation package reflects the level of responsibility and enables a strong start.

Second, time to recharge before onboarding:
Given the intensity of the past cycle, 4 weeks of vacation (or even 3.5 weeks) would make a major difference in ensuring I’m rested and fully focused when I start. Two weeks would be tough for me at this stage.

I’m flexible on the location, remote structure, and handling leadership exposure informally rather than through a formal rotation, as long as we can strengthen compensation and vacation to reflect the level of the role.

If we can align on those two areas, I’m confident we can close quickly.", "Round 3.1 - The Recruiter: Appreciate the clarity. Here’s how I can structure this to respect your August 1 timing and set you up for impact while staying aligned with our leadership norms:

Proposed package:
- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000 (top of band for initial placement)
- Signing bonus: $30,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: None (we’ll line up monthly leadership touchpoints and a scoped collaboration with Blair’s team once you’re settled)

This gives you strong first‑year cash via the sign‑on, maintains on‑site leadership presence, and modestly extends vacation while keeping us within internal equity.

If your remaining sticking point is vacation length, I have one alternative trade-off:
- 3.0 weeks of vacation with a $25,000 signing bonus (all other terms unchanged).

If we can align on the primary package (Aug 1 / New Haven / $135k base / $30k sign-on / 0 remote / 2.5 weeks / no formal Blair rotation), are you comfortable saying yes today so I can issue the offer? If not, would the 3.0 weeks + $25k sign-on variant close it for you?", "Round 3.2 - The Candidate: I appreciate the thoughtful clarity. The August 1 start, the strengthened sign-on, and the willingness to expand vacation are all helpful steps.

The one area I still need us to address is the base salary. A starting point of $135,000 is significantly below market for Director-level online marketing roles, especially given the scope we’ve discussed. Even with a strong sign-on, that base level makes it difficult to ensure the compensation reflects the responsibility of the role.

If we can bring the base into a more appropriate range, even something in the $160K+ band to start, I can be flexible on the other items, including vacation length and the lack of a formal Blair rotation.

For example, something like:

Base salary: around $160,000 / Signing bonus: $30,000 / Vacation: 3.0 to 3.5 weeks

All other terms, as proposed, would allow me to say yes today.

I’m excited about the team and the impact this role can have. If we can get the base closer to where it needs to be, I’m ready to finalize this.", "Round 4.1 - The Recruiter: I hear you on base. I’ve pushed as far as I can internally and need to hold the line on initial placement to protect equity across the leadership team. The cleanest way I can meet your first‑year cash need is via a stronger sign‑on, while keeping the structure that sets you up for impact in New Haven.

Here’s my best package to close today:
- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Signing bonus: $35,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: None (we’ll set up monthly LT touchpoints and a scoped collaboration with Blair’s team in Q3/Q4)

This gives you robust first‑year cash while keeping the role embedded with your cross‑functional partners and preserving leadership norms. It also aligns to what you said works on location, on‑site presence, and no formal rotation.

If we align on this structure now, are you comfortable saying yes so I can issue the offer today?", "Round 4.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for laying this out clearly. I appreciate the flexibility on the sign-on, though I want to be transparent about what would truly make this work for me.

While the stronger signing bonus helps with first-year cash, the base salary remains the key issue. At $135,000, it sits well below market for a Director-level online marketing role, and below what would make sense for me to take on the scope.

I’m actually not urgent about front-loaded cash, I would much prefer a cleaner compensation structure with a stronger base, even if that means a lower sign-on. Something closer to $170,000 in base salary would put the role in a sustainable place for me and align with the level of responsibility we’ve discussed.

Separately, if we move forward without a Blair rotation, I would need 3.5–4 weeks of vacation to ensure the move to New Haven is balanced and sustainable long-term.

So a structure like:

Base salary around $170,000/ Signing bonus adjusted as needed/ 3.5–4 weeks vacation

Or we can do Base salary: $145,000 / Signing bonus: $40,000 as needed/ 3-3.5 weeks vacation

All other terms as proposed. If you are happy with these terms, I would love to say yes.

I’m genuinely excited about the role and team, and if we can align these areas, especially base salary, I’m ready to finalize.", "Round 5.1 - The Recruiter: I appreciate how straightforward you’ve been. Let me be equally clear on where I can land today while protecting internal equity and giving you a strong first year.

Best-and-final proposal:
- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Signing bonus: $40,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: None (we’ll set monthly LT touchpoints and a scoped collaboration with Blair’s team in Q3/Q4)

This keeps the leadership norms intact and delivers $175,000 in first‑year cash, aligns with your start constraint, and anchors you where your impact will be highest.

If you can agree to this structure, I’ll issue the offer today.

If the only blocker is vacation, I have one and only one variant:
- 3.0 weeks of vacation with a $30,000 sign-on (all other terms unchanged).

If we do either of these, are you ready to say yes now so I can get the paperwork out today?", "Round 5.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for putting forward a clear Best-and-final proposal. I appreciate the movement on the sign-on and the alignment on the start date and structure.

Given that the base salary is fixed at $135,000, which I understand may be a hard ceiling for this placement, the remaining area I need to feel fully supported is vacation.

To make the transition sustainable, especially with the move to New Haven and no formal rotation, a 3.5–4 week vacation allocation would put the package in a place where I can say yes today.
Alternatively, if we keep the vacation at 2.5 weeks, incorporating the formal Blair rotation would also make the overall structure work.

If we can align on that adjustment, I’m comfortable moving forward and finalizing the offer now.", "Round 6.1 - The Recruiter: I appreciate you laying out exactly what would make this work. Let’s lock it in via the Blair rotation path you proposed so we can close today.

Here’s my final package:
- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Signing bonus: $10,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: Formal 3‑month rotation in Washington, DC with Blair’s team, scheduled in coordination with Blair’s calendar (we’ll kick off counsel and scheduling immediately and target Q4 timing unless you and Blair prefer earlier)

This meets your stated acceptance condition (2.5 weeks + formal Blair rotation) while keeping the structure you’ve agreed works on start date, location, and on‑site presence. If you’re good with this, say yes and I’ll issue the offer today and loop in counsel to paper the rotation.", "Round 6.2 - The Candidate: Thank you for clarifying the structure. I’m aligned with the Blair rotation path, and the overall framework works for me.

The only item that needs to be corrected before I can finalize is the signing bonus amount. In our previous alignment, the sign-on was set at $40,000, and I’m comfortable moving forward at that level.

Here is the package I can say yes to today:

- Start date: August 1
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Signing bonus: $40,000 (paid at start)
- Remote work: 0 days/week
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: Formal 3-month rotation in Washington, DC

If we confirm the signing bonus at $40,000 as previously proposed, I’m ready to finalize and proceed with the offer."]

["Round 1.1 - The Candidate: Hi! So happy to be here today. I have a few questions to start with:

1. What is a normal range of salary do you offer (25th, 75th, 90th percentile for example)?
2. I really want us to both have a deal that we like (to maximize the pie), so I would like you to know my top concerns. Salary and bonus aside, my top priorities are the start date, vacation weeks, and whether I could work with Blair for a rotation. I'd like to know what issues are your top concerns and whether anything is non-negotiable, also what things are your least concerns (i.e. you're very flexible)
3. I'd like to express that I understand that the company gives out a maximum of 40000 signing bonus. While I really would like that, between, let's say 40000 bonus and 25000 more salary, I'd much prefer having more salary going forward. Of course if you have a completely opposite preference, we can work out the specific number.", "Round 1.2 - The Recruiter: Thanks for laying out your priorities—that’s helpful.

On your questions:
1) Salary ranges: For this Director role, our current base salary band is approximately $135,000–$145,000. Roughly speaking, the 25th percentile sits near $135k, the median around $140k, and the upper end/75th near $145k. The very top end (90th) is essentially the top of that band and only used in rare cases.

2) Our priorities and flexibility:
- Top priorities: New Haven as the work location (that team is scaling), a July onboarding (ideally July 5th to align with our cohort), and strong in‑office presence for leadership/mentorship.
- On Blair: We can’t commit to a 3‑month DC rotation for this role this cycle. I can explore ways to get you exposure to Blair’s workstreams, but a formal 3‑month rotation in DC isn’t something we can support for this position right now.
- Flexibility: We can be flexible on start date within July (July 15th if needed), and on the mix between base and a one‑time sign‑on (within our cap). For remote, our preference is fully in-office, but I can consider a light cadence if the rest of the package aligns.

3) Salary vs. bonus: I hear you. We aim to keep base within band and use sign‑on to smooth transitions. If we align on location/in‑person/start, I’m comfortable steering more toward a modest sign‑on rather than pushing base above band.

With that in mind, here’s a full package I can stand behind as a starting point:
- Start date: July 5th
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Remote work: 0 day(s) / week
- Signing bonus: $5,000
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: No formal rotation (we’ll facilitate touchpoints with Blair’s org)

A few quick questions so I can tune this to what matters most to you:
- Is the 3‑month Blair rotation a must‑have, or would structured exposure (e.g., participation in quarterly DC strategy reviews and joint projects) meet your goals?
- How many vacation weeks are you hoping for?
- Any hard constraints on start date (could July 5th work, or is July 15th necessary)?
- Are you open to New Haven as your home office?
- What in‑office vs. remote cadence would you ideally like?

If we can align on New Haven, July onboarding, and largely in‑person presence, I have room to enhance the sign‑on within our limits.", "Round 2.1 - The Candidate: Thank you for the offer but honestly this is way below my expectations:

I'm relatively flexible on remote work, so I can happily cooperate to work in office. New Haven is absolutely not my top choice, but as it is your no.1 priority, I could accommodate as well. In return, I expect you to let me win on some of my priorities.

Just so you know, if you could offer 
Aug 1st or later start date, 4 weeks vacation, 0 remote days, a 3-month blair rotation, New Haven as home office, 145000 salary and a 40000 signing bonus, I'd sign right now!

Meanwhile, I want to confirm: what i mean by Blair rotation is the 3 months rotation in DC, anything otherwise isn't the same to me. Could you confirm with me whether that is 100% off the table?
Same with Aug 1st or later start date, is it completely off the table or you could potentially accommodate with a less salary?", "Round 2.2 - The Recruiter: I really appreciate how clearly you’ve laid out your priorities, and thank you for the flexibility on New Haven and on being in‑office. Let me be equally clear on our guardrails so we can get to a deal quickly.

Direct answers to your questions:
- 3‑month Blair rotation: For this role, this cycle, a formal 3‑month DC rotation is not available. That’s a firm no. We can arrange structured exposure to Blair’s workstreams (quarterly DC strategy reviews, joint initiatives, and periodic mentorship touchpoints), but not a 3‑month DC stint.
- Aug 1+ start: We need a July start to align with our onboarding and Q3 plan. I can flex from July 5th to July 15th, but August 1+ isn’t something I can approve for this position.

Given your willingness to be in‑office and to base in New Haven, here’s an improved package I can approve today:
- Start date: July 15th
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Remote work: 0 day(s) / week
- Signing bonus: $10,000
- Vacation: 2.5 weeks
- Blair rotation: No formal rotation (we’ll facilitate structured exposure to Blair’s org)

Why this works: It keeps you in the July onboarding wave for maximum impact, maintains strong in‑person leadership presence, and recognizes your value with both cash (base + sign‑on) and added time off relative to our initial offer.

If you can confirm alignment on:
- New Haven as home office
- 0 remote days/week
- No Blair rotation
- July 15th start
- 2.5 weeks vacation
- $135k base with a $10k sign‑on

…I can lock this in immediately. If any single element above is a blocker, tell me exactly which one and your best alternative within these guardrails, and I’ll see if there’s a narrow path to adjust.", "Round 3.1 - The Candidate: I understand that start date in Aug and Blair rotations are non-negotiable. But honestly, this offer really doesn't keep me at the level of my last job. The base salary is so much lower than my expectation, and you're not generous on signing bonus (I've learned that the maximum is 40k). So, I see no point of moving if that's your final offer.

I'll give you two alternative offers that I'd say yes to now.

Offer 1:
July 15 to start
4 weeks vacation
0 remote days
New Haven as home office
145k + 40k signing bonus
(with higher salary, I could consider less vacation days)

Offer 2:
July 15 to start
3 weeks vacation
0 remote days
Philly as home office
145k + 40k signing bonus

if these two offers aren't things that we can work towards, I don't think your team really treasures me joining the company.", "Round 3.2 - The Recruiter: I appreciate how clear you’ve been. I also hear your concern about staying at your prior level. Let me be equally direct so we don’t waste your time.

Where I cannot go:
- 4 weeks vacation isn’t available for this role.
- Philadelphia isn’t an option for this Director slot—the New Haven team needs you.
- Base at $145k plus a $40k sign-on is outside our internal equity and banding.

Where I can stretch to close this now:
- Start date: July 15
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Remote work: 0 day(s) / week
- Signing bonus: $15,000
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: No

This keeps you in the July onboarding wave, puts you in the highest-priority office, provides strong in‑person leadership presence, and delivers meaningful first‑year cash via the sign‑on.

If 2 weeks is the only blocker, my tight fallback (still July 15, New Haven, 0 remote, no Blair) is:
- $135,000 base
- $12,500 sign‑on
- 2.5 weeks vacation

If I put the first package in writing right now, can you say yes today? And if not, is it specifically the 2 vs. 2.5 weeks that’s standing in the way?", "Round 4.1 - The Candidate: Between your two offers, I'd prefer the 2.5 weeks one, but they're both way below my standards. There's no actually blocker except for the final money that I'll make.

If you're being honest with me, I feel like this is really difficult for us to have an agreement. I want to understand a few things:

1. If I do everything you want (July 5th, 2 weeks vacation, 0 remote, no Blair rotation, New haven), What's the maximum package could you give me? I want you to understand, if you're giving your current offer, there's no deal and I'll walk away immediately. Anything above 145k + 40k bonus or 155k + 20k bonus can bring me back to the table but i'll still be just taking a crumb. I understand that market rate is between 145k to 155k and I have even better quality than average. I want to understand why you're blocking me on the salary.

2. Outside all issues we've discussed, is there anything else you could offer me to compensate for this small salary? For example, trip fund, remote weeks (different from remote days of a week), housing subsidy, etc.

3. I want to understand what you'd do if you don't hire me.", "Round 4.2 - The Recruiter: I appreciate the candor. Let me answer your questions directly and move us toward a concrete close.

1) “If I do everything you want, what’s the maximum package?”
- Here is the best cash package I can approve today if you align to our priorities (New Haven, in‑office, no Blair rotation, July onboarding, 2 weeks vacation):
  - Start date: July 5th (strong preference; I can honor July 15th if absolutely needed)
  - Work location: New Haven, CT
  - Base salary: $135,000
  - Remote: 0 day(s) / week
  - Signing bonus: $30,000 (paid in first payroll; can split if you prefer)
  - Vacation: 2 weeks
  - Blair rotation: No (we’ll facilitate structured exposure to Blair’s org)

That puts your year‑one cash at $165,000 before any performance bonus or merit cycle, plus benefits.

Why not increase base? We maintain tight internal equity at the Director level and bring new Directors in consistent with the current cohort; we use a one‑time sign‑on to bridge transitions and then true‑up through the early performance/merit process. I can also commit to an accelerated compensation review at 6 months with eligibility for a base adjustment based on impact.

If July 15th is necessary, I can keep the above package exactly the same; my strong preference is July 5th to stay aligned with cohort onboarding.

2) Other ways to offset salary
Within policy, I can add:
- Relocation/temporary housing support: up to 30 days corporate housing or a relocation stipend
- Professional development: dedicated budget for one external conference plus courses/certifications in your first year
- Executive mentorship: guaranteed quarterly strategy touchpoints with Blair’s org and DC leadership, plus executive coaching sessions in H1
- Work‑from‑anywhere flexibility: one week in your first year (separate from day‑to‑day in‑office cadence)

These don’t change base, but they increase your first‑year value and career trajectory.

3) If we don’t hire you
We do have strong finalists we could move forward with. That said, you’re our first choice for this role, and I’m putting meaningful cash on the table to make this work now.

Here’s my ask so we can finish this today:
- If I put the package below in writing, can you sign today?
  - July 5th start (July 15th if you truly need it)
  - New Haven, CT
  - $135,000 base
  - $30,000 sign‑on
  - 0 remote days/week
  - 2 weeks vacation
  - No Blair rotation

If you can’t say yes to that, please give me one number: the exact signing bonus that would close today with base fixed at $135k, New Haven, 0 remote, 2 weeks vacation, and a July start (5th preferred, 15th acceptable). If there’s a narrow gap, I’ll see if I can bridge it right now.", "Round 5.1 - The Candidate: I recognize that you value my preference to start on July 15 and offered the same package aside from the start date. I'd also love to have all benefits you are offering, especially the housing support and one week work-from-anywhere flexibility.

Unfortunately, what you offered (even with July 15th) is outside my scope.

I'd like to make three offers:
all with July 15th start date, 0 remote days, no Blair rotation, New Haven as the home office

Offer 1: 2.5 weeks vacation + 145k+30k bonus
Offer 2: 3.5 weeks vacation + 135k+40k bonus
Offer 3: 3 weeks vacation +142k +30k bonus

I think that you should recognize all the concessions I've made. I'm accommodating to all the needs within the team and tried to work on the number. I know that vacation days are less valuable to you than cash, and please understand that anything significant below this number, I'll walk away. I'm only at the table because I think you're near your limit as well, while I'm definitely at mine.", "Round 5.2 - The Recruiter: I appreciate how transparent you’ve been and the flexibility you’ve shown on New Haven, in‑office, and no Blair rotation. I also hear you on total cash. Let me be crystal clear on where I can and cannot go so we can close this.

What I can’t do:
- Increase base above band for this role (so not $142k or $145k)
- Increase vacation beyond 2 weeks for this Director slot

Here are two close‑now options I can approve today. If you pick either, I’ll get the letter out immediately.

Option A (optimize onboarding + higher sign‑on):
- Start date: July 5th
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Remote: 0 day(s) / week
- Signing bonus: $32,500 (paid in first payroll; can split if you prefer)
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: No

Option B (your preferred date):
- Start date: July 15th
- Work location: New Haven, CT
- Base salary: $135,000
- Remote: 0 day(s) / week
- Signing bonus: $30,000
- Vacation: 2 weeks
- Blair rotation: No

Included in both, day one:
- Relocation support (up to 30 days corporate housing or stipend)
- One week work‑from‑anywhere in year one
- Professional development budget (conference + courses/certifications)
- Structured executive mentorship and quarterly strategy touchpoints with Blair’s org

If neither Option A nor B works, give me one number: the exact signing bonus that would close today with base fixed at $135k, vacation at 2 weeks, New Haven, 0 remote, and a July start. If it’s within reach, I will try to make it happen in our final round.", "Round 6.1 - The Candidate: I think you're lying to me - you just said that 145k was within range for top candidates, and you offered 2.5 weeks of vacation to me.

Please be truly honest with me. The current deal is outside my zone and I'd walk away if that's your final offer.

With July 15th, 0 remote days, no Blair rotation, New Haven as the home office, and all the benefits above, my final offers are:

1. 2 weeks vacation, 140k+35k bonus
2. 2.5 weeks vacation, 135k +40k bonus
3. 2 weeks vacation, 135k +45k bonus
4. 2 weeks vacation, 138k + 38k bonus

Please keep in mind that your current offer IS way below my BATNA, I WILL walk away if that's your final offer.", "Round 6.2 - The Recruiter: $DEAL_REACHED$
